caption.p: Bone marrow pathologies associated with human viral infections.

tr.td: Driven by infection of erythroid progenitors
EBV, CMV, VZV, HHV, HIV, HAV, and HCV
Driven by a strong antiviral T cell response and ensuing cytokine production
Driven by the ensuing antiviral immune response rather than the virus itself
Infectious mononucleosis and chronic active EBV disease
Acute myeloid leukemia, primary myelodysplastic syndrome

fn.p: Table reproduced from Pascutti MF, Erkelens MN, Nolte MA. Impact of viral infections on hematopoiesis: from beneficial to detrimental effects on Bone marrow output. Front Immunol 2016;7:364. Reprinted under https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/.
